meanings.definition: The time of life when one is a calf.
meanings.sent1: During calfhood, the young calf learns to walk and run.
meanings.sent2: My favorite memory from calfhood is playing in the green meadow.
meanings.sent3: In calfhood, the mischievous calf tried to jump over the fence but got stuck!
meanings.sent4: The innocence of calfhood is like a gentle breeze on a summer day.
meanings.sent5: The farmer cherished the calfhood of his animals, watching them grow and thrive.

meanings.definition: The state or quality of being a calf.
meanings.sent1: The calfhood of the young animal was evident in its playful behavior.
meanings.sent2: The farm was filled with the sounds of mooing, a true sign of calfhood.
meanings.sent3: The calfhood of the herd brought joy to the entire farm.
meanings.sent4: The calfhood of the newborn calf was a symbol of new beginnings.
meanings.sent5: The farmer admired the calfhood of the herd, a reminder of the cycle of life.
